intro: Oryzopsis vavilovii, commonly known as Vavilov's grass, is a species of annual grass native to central Asia. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spikelet-bearing inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features include narrow leaves and a fibrous root system, which aid in its survival in arid environments. Oryzopsis vavilovii is of interest to botanists due to its potential role in plant evolution and its adaptability to harsh conditions.
